intro: Microtrichomanes zamboanganum, commonly known as Zamboanga fern, is a rare and endemic fern species found in the Philippines. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds. The plant typically grows on shaded, moist rock surfaces in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are covered with fine trichomes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
